node.title: Rio Tinto says it wants to delay closure of Tiwai Point smelter
node.description: Rio Tinto says it believes there is a long-term future for the Bluff operation past its previously signalled closure date in 2024.

node.title: 'Robo-advice' a low-cost option for financial planning
node.description: Only two firms offer low-cost computer-generated financial advice, despite it being available for four years.

node.title: Innovation necessary for sustainable financial future - Reserve Bank governor
node.description: Reserve Bank Governor Adrian Orr says the future of money and cash is at a "crossroad" and innovation is necessary to build a sustainable future.

node.title: California to roll back mask mandate after current rules expire next week
node.description: Everyone — vaccinated or not — will have to continue wearing masks in higher-risk areas like public transit and nursing homes.

node.title: 'Heartbreaking': Gillespie responds to Langer resignation and prospect of taking over as Australian head coach
node.description: Former Test quick Jason Gillespie defends Justin Langer as a coach, while responding to claims the South Australian is next in line to be head coach.

node.title: Four COVID-19 deaths in SA as government refuses to budge on postal voting changes
node.description: There have been four COVID-19-related deaths in South Australia in the past 24 hours, including a man in his 30s.

node.title: WA COVID cases expected to rise sharply around February 28, with elective surgeries restricted
node.description: With an uptick in COVID-19 cases anticipated at the end of the month, WA health authorities move to suspend new bookings for non-urgent elective surgeries in a bid to ease pressure on hospitals.

node.title: Biden science adviser Eric Lander resigns after acknowledging "demeaning" conduct
node.description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki confirmed he had been investigated after a complaint was filed.

node.title: PM Jacinda Ardern says Omicron peak could be in late March
node.description: After a record number of Covid-19 cases were reported on Saturday, the prime minister believes the country's Omicron peak may be in late March.

node.title: Wānaka A&P Show cancelled over Covid-19 restrictions
node.description: The Wānaka A&P Show has been cancelled for the first time since World War II, due to Covid-19 restrictions.

node.title: Rotorua farm fined $27k for bush-grazing pigs
node.description: Rotorua's Kleadmak Farms has been fined $27,000 after pigs were found grazing in native bush and effluent discharged into Umurua Stream.

node.title: Aleksandr Selevko of Estonia powers through with a dislocated shoulder.
node.description: Several days ago he dislocated his right shoulder in training.

node.title: What jump will you hear most about at these Olympics?
node.description: The quad, of course, which requires four revolutions and has nothing to do with the courtyard at your alma mater.

node.title: South Korea is appealing the disqualification of two short-track speedskaters.
node.description: The South Korean Olympic Committee said that the relationship between the international sports community and the referees “was biased and not transparent.”

node.title: 'Traumatising' - Cleaners post aftermath photos of crime, suspected suicides on social media
node.description: A crime scene cleaning business has been posting images of the aftermath of suspected suicides, attempted suicides, assaults and domestic violence. Audio

node.title: Many SMEs not using delegation or technology to increase productivity - survey
node.description: Small businesses are working harder but their productivity is waning, according to a survey by an accounting software firm.

node.title: Political poll: Labour, National up, ACT down
node.description: Labour and National have both seen their popularity increase in the first Newshub-Reid Research poll of the year.

node.title: Air Force ordered to pay more than $230 million in 2017 Texas church shooting
node.description: The shooting at First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, was the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history.

node.title: Luring Kiwis back to farm 'essential' amid border closure
node.description: The agricultural sector in North Canterbury has expressed relief at the Government's border reopening plan, but those on the ground have highlighted a wider issue farmers are facing - a lack of…

node.title: Design team selected for new Picton and Wellington ferry terminals
node.description: The design team will take the existing concept design through to final design, ahead of construction starting later this year.

node.title: Top firms exaggerating climate progress - study
node.description: Companies including Google, Amazon and Ikea are not meeting their own green targets, a study finds.

node.title: Venue outside Whakatāne being sought for trial over Whakaari eruption
node.description: The trial into the health and safety failings leading up to the Whakaari eruption is likely to be held outside Whakatāne.

node.title: Vaccination rates in area that is home to Gloriavale community improves
node.description: One of New Zealand's most remote and isolated communities has now reached 90 percent of its population over 12 getting at least one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine.

node.title: Officer should not have released police dog that bit man, IPCA says
node.description: An investigation has found the police were not justified in deploying a dog that bit a man during an arrest, requiring him to need stitches.

node.title: Man who worked for DHS admits sending fake government letter to couple
node.description: Ralph Karau, who once had a top-secret security clearance, invented a State Department official to confront the couple after his daughter alleged the two had mistreated her.

node.title: Man pleads guilty to historical indecent assault linked to Dilworth School
node.description: Alister Grant Harlow of Hillsborough pleaded guilty to three charges including two of indecent assault, dating back 30 years.

node.title: Able Fit program helps build strength: "It is a gym that believes in me!"
node.description: Some of the athletes are autistic, others have Down syndrome or cerebral palsy. Stronger muscles aren't the only benefit.

node.title: Supreme Court halts redraw of Alabama's Congressional map
node.description: A lower court had ordered the GOP legislature to draw a second Black-majority district.

node.title: Body recovered from Clutha River believed to be missing man
node.description: Police officers searching for a missing man in Central Otago have recovered a body from the Clutha River.

node.title: Labor Secretary Marty Walsh speaks to MLB and players' association
node.description: The sides appear far apart with the season just around the corner.
